intro: Pouzolzia confinis, commonly known as the rock nettle, is a perennial shrub native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs.
